docs.snippet: HOLLYWOOD, Calif., Feb. 13-- "Autobahn," a story about operations by the United States Army of Occupation against black-market traders in Germany, written for the screen by Lawrence P. Bachman, chief of the State Department film section in Berlin,...
docs.lead_paragraph: HOLLYWOOD, Calif., Feb. 13-- "Autobahn," a story about operations by the United States Army of Occupation against black-market traders in Germany, written for the screen by Lawrence P. Bachman, chief of the State Department film section in Berlin, has been purchased by Metro Goldwyn-Mayer.

headline.main: METRO WILL MAKE 'AUTOBAHN' FILM; Acquires L.P. Bachman Story About Army Action Against German Black Marketers Of Local Origin

byline.original: By THOMAS F. BRADY Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Commercial buying of British sterling lifted those documents to approximately the Bank of England's selling rate of -cent premium per month over spot. Absence of grain bills also contributed to the hardening and at the close all contracts had widened...
docs.lead_paragraph: Commercial buying of British sterling lifted those documents to approximately the Bank of England's selling rate of -cent premium per month over spot. Absence of grain bills also contributed to the hardening and at the close all contracts had widened by 1/8 cent over the week, with six months at $2.81 3/8.
